RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 1 1 1/16M Turf CR: 91. Claiming Purse 19000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race at a mile or over since May 29 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000 (Claiming races for $8,500 or less not considered in estimating allowances). In the event that this race is taken off the turf it will be contested at One Mile and One-Sixteenth on the main track.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FLY NIGHTLY raced in the two path around the first turn, pressed the pace on the outside racing up the backstretch, dueled from the two path around the far bend and into the lane and edged clear late. DRIVEN ONE led the field while saving ground through the opening half mile, dueled from the rail around the far bend and continued to battle back gamely in the stretch, giving way late. DYNABLUE saved ground early, settled in the middle of the pack on the inside for the run up the backstretch, continued to save ground around the far turn and gained ground in the final furlong. IOYA AGAIN saved ground around the first turn, raced off the pace up the backstretch, came around the second turn in the three path and improved position mildly in the stretch. ANDTHETHUNDERROLLS saved ground around the first turn, continued up the backstretch in the middle of the pack on the outside, navigated the far turn from the three path and finished evenly while never threatening. MITZRAYIM raced in the middle of the pack on the inside around the first turn and up the backstretch, continued around the second turn in the two path and weakened in the lane. KRAMDEN trailed the field from the two path throughout and was never a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Driven One
ENTRY.OWNER: Muddy Waters Stables LLC Mason Ingrid and Edmondson Ronnie

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 2 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 90. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 20000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $6,500 OR LESS IN 2022 - 2023 OR CLAIMING PRICE $13,500. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race at a mile or over since May 29 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Pric e $13,500 (Claiming races for $10,000 or less not considered in allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DANVILLE raced in the two path around the first turn, tracked the leader between horses up the backstretch, came around the far bend in the two and three path, launched a bid passing the quarter pole, dueled in the stretch and pulled clear late. GAME BOY BENNY saved ground around the first turn, led the way up the backstretch, navigated the far turn from the two path and dueled gamely in the lane, giving way in the final strides. GLOBAL EMPIRE raced in the three path early, settled off the pace between horses for the run up the backstretch, saved ground around the second bend and finished evenly. HIGH BROW saved ground around the first turn, stalked the pace setter on the inside up the backstretch, came around the far turn in the three and four path and was outkicked from there. GOLD BUCKLE chased the leader on the outside through the opening half mile, swung out to the four path for the run around the far turn and tired in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Gold Buckle
ENTRY.OWNER: Clabar Mor Stables LLC and Haran Thoroughbreds LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 3 1M Turf CR: 71. Maiden Claiming Purse 16000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $17,500. In the event that this race is taken off the turf it will be contested at One Mile and Seventy Yards on the main track.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LOTTA ROSES was bumped by EVIE JEAN and carried out to the five path when that rival ran out headed into the first turn, settled to stalk the leaders on the outside up the backstretch, began a bid from the four path coming around the far turn, dueled in the lane and kicked clear. SANGFROID chased the leader on the inside through the opening half mile, saved ground around the turn, began a bid passing the quarter pole, dueled in upper stretch and could not go with the winner late but kept on to the wire. ARRINGTON saved ground early, trailed the field on the inside up the backstretch, came around the far turn in the two path and improved position in the lane. TEXAS PRINCESS raced off the pace on the inside around the first turn and up the backstretch, navigated the second turn from the three path and passed tiring horses in the stretch. EVIE JEAN blew the first turn, bumping with LOTTA ROSES and carrying several rivals wide in the process, straightened out to duel on the outside up the backstretch, continued to battle from the four path around the far turn and faded in the lane. STRONGENOUGHSTORM was carried out to the seven path when EVIE JEAN ran out headed into the first turn, raced outside at the back of the pack from there, came around the far turn in the three path and made no bid. VELVET SEASON saved ground around the first turn, dueled on the inside up the backstretch, continued to save ground around the far bend and tired in the stretch. DUE TO A TIMER MALFUNCTION, THE HALF MILE SPLIT FOR THIS RACE WAS HAND TIMED.

ENTRY.NAME: Sangfroid
ENTRY.OWNER: Irion Heather and Kaufmann Racing LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 83. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 36000. FOR FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR STATE BRED OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $62,500. Weight, 122 lbs. Non-winners of a race since May 29 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $62 ,500 (Claiming races for $40,000 or less not considered in estimating allowances) (Preference by condition eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BLACK FOREST bumped mildly with the horse to his inside at the start, led the field up the backstretch, opened up while saving ground around the turn and continued to draw off in the lane. WILMA MANKILLER chased the leader on the inside early, raced into traffic and steadied nearing the half mile pole, came around the bend in the three path and kept on in the lane but was no match for the winner. SWEET NELLIE veered out and bumped with the horse to her outside leaving the gate, recovered to stalk the leader between horses early, came around the turn in the two path and was outkicked in the lane. SALLY'S SUPRISE trailed the field through the opening quarter of a mile, saved ground around the turn made up some ground in the stretch while never threatening the winner. FROSHADO tracked the pace setter on the outside up the backstretch, navigated the turn from the three path and faded in the stretch. A STEWARDS INQUIRY WAS MADE INTO THE TRAFFIC HEADED INTO THE TURN. UPON REVIEW, NO CHANGES WERE MADE TO THE ORDER OF FINISH. DUE TO A TIMER MALFUNCTION, THE FIVE FURLONG SPLIT FOR THIS RACE WAS HAND TIMED.

ENTRY.NAME: Sweet Nellie
ENTRY.OWNER: Kane Mark E and Rosin Coty W

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 5 5 1/2F Turf CR: 83. Allowance Purse 36000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race since May 29 Al lowed 2 lbs. (Claiming races for $20,000 or less not considered in estimating allowances) (Preference by condition eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CHROME ATTACK chased the leader on the inside up the backstretch, raced in the two path around the turn, began a bid passing the quarter pole and kicked clear in the lane. PEACH COBBLER dueled on the inside early, led the field while saving ground around the bend and could not go with the winner in the stretch but chased that rival home. BLAME NELLIE raced off the pace up the backstretch, came around the bend in the three and four path, swung wide entering the stretch and improved position from there. GOOD MONGOLIA raced in the middle of the pack through the opening quarter of a mile, continued around the turn in the two path and finished evenly. MY LADY SLEW pressed the pace on the outside up the backstretch, raced in the three path around the turn and faded in the stretch. BIPARTISAN BROOKE hopped up leaving the gate and was away slowly, trailed the field up the backstretch, saved ground around the bend and made no bid. DUE TO A TIMER MALFUNCTION, THE FIVE FURLONG SPLIT FOR THIS RACE IS HAND TIMED.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 6 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 67. Claiming Purse 12000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES IN 2022 - 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE SEPTEMBER 29, 2022. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race since May 29 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Pric e $5,000 (Claiming races for $4,000 or less not considered in eligibility and allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FOGGY KITTEN led the way under a hold up the backstretch, raced in the two path around the turn and held clear to the wire. RANK AND FILE raced off the pace early, saved ground around the turn and improved position in the lane while never threatening the winner. BAILESTON LASSIE chased the leader up the backstretch, raced in the three path around the turn, swung wide into the stretch and was outkicked in the lane while drifting out. KITTEN ROCKS trailed the field the entire way around the oval, raced in the three path around the bend and was never a factor.

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Kenneth L. Ramsey & Sarah K. Ramsey

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 7 1M Turf CR: 80. Maiden Special Weight Purse 35000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Preference by condition eligibility). In the event that this race is taken off the turf it will be contested at One Mile and Seventy Yards on the main track.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TEN COUNT led the field while saving ground around the first turn and up the backstretch, dueled from the rail around the far bend and in upper stretch, pulled clear with a furlong to go and held that margin to the finish. ICE SHARD saved ground early, trailed the field up the backstretch, raced in the three path around the far turn, swung wide to began a bid approaching the quarter pole, bumped mildly with EVEN THE WIND in upper stretch and gained ground late. EVEN THE WIND raced off the pace between horses through the opening half mile, came around the turn in the two path, bumped lightly with ICE SHARD in upper stretch, raced into traffic and switched to the outside in the final furlong and gained ground late from there. J J'S SOLUTION raced in the three path around the first turn, tracked the pace setter on the outside up the backstretch, challenged coming around the far bend, dueled in the lane and weakened late. SHARP STICK was carried out to the four path racing around the first turn, settled in the middle of the pack on the inside for the run up the backstretch, saved ground around the far turn, improved position in upper stretch and finished evenly. RUSSIAN STANDARD raced at the back of the pack on the outside through the opening half mile, was carried out to the five path coming around the far bend and was outkicked in the lane. JAKES CHANNEL raced in the two path around the first turn, pressed the pace between horses up the backstretch, tired after a half mile and was eased in the stretch.
